title: Ghost Town at Sundown
blurb: Test your comprehension of Magic Tree House #10: Ghost Town at Sundown. Questions focus on understanding the story, characters, and key events to show proof of reading.

teachingNotes: This lesson tests reading comprehension of Magic Tree House #10: Ghost Town at Sundown. Students should have read the book before attempting these questions. Focus on story recall, character understanding, and plot sequence. Key themes include the American frontier, friendship, helping others, and understanding history. Encourage students to think about the difference between legends and facts.

wordProblems.question: Jack and Annie arrive in Tombstone at 3:00 PM. They spend 2 hours looking for Lonesome Luke and 1 hour helping him find Dusty. What time do they finish their adventure?
If Lonesome Luke has been looking for his horse for 3 days, and Jack and Annie help him find Dusty in 1 day, how many total days was Dusty missing?
The ghost town has 12 buildings on Main Street. If 8 of them are empty stores and the rest are saloons, how many saloons are there?
Jack brought 5 research books in his backpack. If he uses 2 books to learn about the Old West and gives 1 book to Annie, how many books does he have left?
If a stagecoach travels 8 miles per hour and needs to go 24 miles to the next town, how long will the journey take?
Lonesome Luke has been a cowboy for 15 years. If he got Dusty 8 years ago, how many years was he a cowboy before he got Dusty?
The saloon has 6 tables with 4 chairs each. How many chairs are in the saloon total?
If Jack and Annie's adventure lasts from sundown (6 PM) until they return to the tree house at 9 PM, how long were they in the Old West?
Dusty the horse can run 20 miles per hour. If he runs for 30 minutes to find Luke, how far does he travel?
The ghost town was abandoned 25 years before Jack and Annie arrive. If they visit in 1881, what year was the town abandoned?
